snippet: Researchers in Sweden have discovered a single gene that could explain why some horses can trot or pace and why others cannot, a finding that could greatly affect harness racing.
abstract: Scientists at Sweden's Uppsala University discover that a single gene largely explains why some horses can trot or pace, making them suitable for harness racing, and why some cannot.
lead_paragraph: Researchers in Sweden have discovered a single gene that could explain why some horses can trot or pace and why others cannot, a finding that could greatly affect harness racing.

headline.seo: Scientists Find Gene Can Explain Horses’ Ability to Pace
headline.main: Horses’ Ability to Pace Is Written in DNA
headline.print_headline: Ability to Pace Is Written in DNA Of Some Horses
